argument.description: A number or date that will be converted to a string.
Optional. This is the format that will be used to convert value to a string.
Optional. This is the nls language used to convert value to a string.

returnType: The TO_CHAR function returns a string value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL TO_CHAR function converts a number or date to a string.
sample:
TO_CHAR(1210.73, '9999.9')
Result: ' 1210.7'

TO_CHAR(-1210.73, '9999.9')
Result: '-1210.7'

TO_CHAR(1210.73, '9,999.99')
Result: ' 1,210.73'

TO_CHAR(1210.73, '$9,999.00')
Result: ' $1,210.73'

TO_CHAR(21, '000099')
Result: ' 000021' TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'yyyy/mm/dd')
Result: '2003/07/09'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'Month DD, YYYY')
Result: 'July 09, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMonth DD, YYYY')
Result: 'July 9, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'MON DDth, YYYY')
Result: 'JUL 09TH, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMON DDth, YYYY')
Result: 'JUL 9TH, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMon ddth, YYYY')
Result: 'Jul 9th, 2003' TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMonth DD, YYYY')
Result: 'July 9, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMON DDth, YYYY')
Result: 'JUL 9TH, 2003'

TO_CHAR(sysdate, 'FMMon ddth, YYYY')
Result: 'Jul 9th, 2003'
